events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car at an intersection resulting in visible damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on initial report mentioning car collision and damages.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the case to assist the policyholder with the process.
Acknowledgment was sent to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and next steps.
Request was made for vehicle repair estimates, accident police report, and photographic evidence of collision damage.
Customer submitted all requested documents including repair quotes, police report, and photos of the damaged vehicle.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted third parties involved in the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded confirming liability details and extent of damages sustained to the customer's vehicle.
A settlement offer was proposed based on damage assessments and policy coverage limits for the auto accident claim.
Customer provided positive feedback regarding clear communication and timely handling of their vehicle accident claim.
The auto accident claim was officially approved following the acceptance of the proposed settlement by the customer.
Payment was issued to the customer to cover approved repair costs for the vehicle after the accident claim approval.
The auto accident claim case was officially closed as payments were completed and no further action required.
